newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada hopes to allocate timber quotas by October.
newsitem.headline: Canada hopes to allocate timber quotas by October.

text.p: Canadian International Trade Minister Art Eggleton said on Tuesday he hoped to reach agreement soon among the provinces and the timber industry on dividing up Canada's quota for exports to the United States.

"I think we're no more than two or three weeks away from doing it (getting agreement) so that we can give adequate notice of the system that will go into effect on October 1," Eggleton told reporters after a cabinet meeting.
He said the priority was to maintain business as usual as much as possible.

Canada agreed in April that duty-free softwood lumber exports from the four main exporting provinces -- British Columbia, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta -- would be limited to 14.7 billion board feet per year.
That requires allocating this both among the provinces and among the various sectors of the industry.
